channel.title: PayPal payment held
channel.description:
Just recently, a payment made to me from someone that bought a virtual good from me was held by PayPal for further review, and it seems that the payment has been declared as an unauthorized purchase. The purchase was made on June 3, 2013, which means it has been 21 days since the payment was sent to me. I have backed up my virtual services with payment terms and even a refund policy, but this payment was completely handled and the buyer DID receive his virtual good, and I have proof.
Anyways, I was wondering how these types of disputes usually turn out with PayPal?

item.title: PayPal payment held
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

jk lmao

Read full topic

item.title: PayPal payment held
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

back when i ran a server i pretty much social-engineered my way out of most chargebacks. i had a nice win/loss ratio, but consider me lucky. also, remember that the two major types of chargebacks (unauthorized dispute and item not received) evidently have to be dealt with differently. my general strategy was to bs everything for the former (a little ironic because it wasn’t bs at all) and present a ‘this is a virtual item’ case for the latter, which theoretically should work all the time cuz paypal’s buyer protection doesn’t cover virtual goods (unless paypal changed its policy in the last two years.) it worked for me; it might not quite work for you.

you can try to present your ‘no refunds’ policy, but you cannot be certain that it will work.

it helps to possess good writing skills when writing to paypal. just remember to capitalize your sentences and use your best grammar in each rebuttal so you won’t look like a complete moron, and you’ll be fine.

[quote=“Tutorial, post:13, topic:522753”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=641251.msg4320394#msg4320394 date=1372144919]
How about you remove his membership? Or if he was already using it, just ban him
[/quote]
I haven’t take any action against his membership, and I’ll most likely wait until PayPal’s decision is final. I’ve heard that PayPal usually tends to rule in favor of the buyer, which is completely ridiculous in this case. The only reason I’m really paranoid about the outcome is that I’ve already used the money to go towards the server in which the memberships are given, so I’m pretty much in the negative. I’m going to try to call them by phone tomorrow and see what I can do, but from what I’ve seen so far, it seems like I’m fighting a losing battle.

I really appreciate the help so far, and I’ll let you all know what happens whenever I get in touch with PayPal. Thanks![/quote]

i’ve been in the negatives a few times before. it turned out to be okay though, although my biggest case (of about $400) took about half a year to complete. the end result? it felt great.

by the way, despite the odds, remember that paypal is actually on your side in this situation…

Read full topic

item.title: PayPal payment held
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

A while back someone donated $50 to me. After receiving his shit he decided to do the same thing. His complaint was that the URL changed. I informed paypal that in fact the server was still up, etc etc. My account at that time was -$50. So paypal is losing money because you spend it. As long as you fight it I doubt paypal is going to do that to themselves. Needless to say, at the end of the dispute paypal was in favor of me as the seller and I have a feeling it was because of my acc balance.

Read full topic

item.title: PayPal payment held
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:5, topic:522753”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=641251.msg4320282#msg4320282 date=1372131025]
then make your case. Your best bet is to literally show proof for everything, have video proof, etc. You should ask whack for more information. I had a huge message I sent him when he asked me about this but I have deleted it since then so yeah.
[/quote]
I believe I have that PM still. I can send it to you if you need it @Tutorial.[/quote]please message that to both of us

Read full topic

item.title: PayPal payment held
item.dc:creator: @ggallin ggallin
item.description:
@ggallin wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:17, topic:522753”][quote author=ggallin link=topic=641251.msg4320450#msg4320450 date=1372157023]

To get this to end, you need to do the following:

Complete 10 successful sales.
Receive at least $250.00 in payments for goods or services.
Be a seller for at least 60 days.

Also to make it go faster (only a weeks wait) mark the item shipment as processed by unknown or if you have the data use that company.

Read the thread. He is obviously past the 10 sales, well past 60 days, can assume he is over the $250 limit, and this is for virtual goods, there is no shipment involved.

The matter at hand here is those are all required, $250 limit is probably not exceeded imho. also i never ship anything but i still have to mark my items as shipped and processed.
[/quote]
The payment is being held because of a dispute, not because he is a first time seller. Your entire post has no use in contributing[/quote]
lmfao k…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

Davidi2:

How about you remove his membership? Or if he was already using it, just ban him

I haven’t take any action against his membership, and I’ll most likely wait until PayPal’s decision is final. I’ve heard that PayPal usually tends to rule in favor of the buyer, which is completely ridiculous in this case. The only reason I’m really paranoid about the outcome is that I’ve already used the money to go towards the server in which the memberships are given, so I’m pretty much in the negative. I’m going to try to call them by phone tomorrow and see what I can do, but from what I’ve seen so far, it seems like I’m fighting a losing battle.

I really appreciate the help so far, and I’ll let you all know what happens whenever I get in touch with PayPal. Thanks!

item.title: PayPal payment held
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

If it is a legitimate unauthorized transaction the only thing you can do is to revoke the membership like David said.

If you have the access logs, make sure you include any and all IPs from the user for PayPal to run against his account.

Read full topic

item.title: PayPal payment held
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2

item.title: PayPal payment held
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:9, topic:522753”][quote author=Tutorial link=topic=641251.msg4320353#msg4320353 date=1372141128]

While not quite the same situation, perhaps I can help.

I sold an item on gumtree, for reference it was a GoPro for $200. The buyer claimed he never received it, though I did send it, and because I couldn’t prove I had posted it, PayPal ruled in his favor.

He messaged my phone (guess he got my number from the ad) to rub it in, with a photo of my GoPro. I probably could of pursued it further but I learned my lesson to always keep a record of when I have sent something (i.e tracking, proof of postage). If you can prove you provided the item, you will win the dispute.

Although the item is a virtual good (it is a membership on my Minecraft server), I can prove he did receive the membership, only in terms of visual evidence though.
[/quote]
I’m sure if you can prove he did, you’re fine[/quote]
I just really don’t know how I could show present proof for this type of good.

Read full topic
